[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Lines: 185-188] [Base ordering] The bases vector [self.pp.G, self.eks[i]] must be in correct order for C_ij computation - can incorrect ordering be exploited to swap the message and randomness components, breaking security? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Lines: 194-201] [Randomness MSM] The randomness R_j computation only uses pp.H and r_j - is this sufficient, or can an attacker forge randomness values that pass verification but break decryption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Function: msm_terms()] [Empty input] What happens if the witness has empty plaintext_chunks or plaintext_randomness? Can this bypass encryption or cause invalid ciphertexts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Function: Homomorphism::msm_eval()] [Unchecked MSM failure] The MSM computation uses expect() to unwrap - if MSM fails due to invalid points or scalars, can this be exploited to DoS the DKG protocol by causing panics during dealing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Lines: 209-211] [MSM security] The VariableBaseMSM trait is used without additional validation - can an attacker exploit implementation bugs in the MSM algorithm to compute incorrect ciphertexts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Function: msm_eval()] [Length mismatch] Are bases and scalars arrays always the same length? Can mismatched lengths cause the MSM to use wrong values or panic? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Function: msm_eval()] [Scalar validity] Are scalars validated to be in the correct field before MSM? Can out-of-range scalars cause incorrect ciphertext computation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Function: Homomorphism::apply()] [Composition safety] The apply() function composes msm_terms() and apply_msm() - can errors in either stage go undetected, producing invalid ciphertexts that pass verification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Lines: 124-126] [Performance DoS] The apply() function processes entire witness at once - can an attacker provide an extremely large witness to cause memory exhaustion or timeout during DKG dealing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Function: correlated_randomness()] [Correlation break] The function generates correlated randomness where r_0 is computed from other r_i values - can an attacker break this correlation to forge ciphertexts that decrypt incorrectly or leak information? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Lines: 225-244] [Zero r_0 vulnerability] The r_vals[0] is initialized as F::zero() placeholder - if the function returns early or errors occur, can this zero value be used, completely breaking encryption security? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Function: correlated_randomness()] [Remainder calculation] The remainder is computed as -= r * cur_base - can integer overflow or underflow in this subtraction lead to incorrect r_0 values that break the homomorphic property? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Lines: 229-239] [Radix overflow] The cur_base is repeatedly multiplied by radix_f - can this overflow the field modulus, causing incorrect correlation and breaking chunk reconstruction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Function: correlated_randomness()] [RNG bias] The sample_field_element() is called for each r_i - is this cryptographically secure, or can biased randomness be exploited to narrow the search space for brute-forcing decryption keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Lines: 234-235] [Loop bounds] The loop runs from 1 to num_chunks - can off-by-one errors cause missing or extra randomness values that break encryption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Function: correlated_randomness()] [Capacity allocation] Vec::with_capacity(num_chunks as usize) is used - can extremely large num_chunks cause allocation failures or memory exhaustion during DKG? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Lines: 241] [Assignment timing] The r_vals[0] = remainder assignment happens after the loop - can race conditions in concurrent access lead to reading the zero placeholder instead of the correct value? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Function: correlated_randomness()] [Radix validation] The radix parameter is not validated - can an attacker pass radix=0, radix=1, or extremely large radix values to break the correlation or cause divide-by-zero errors? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Function: correlated_randomness()] [num_chunks=0] What happens if num_chunks is 0? Can this return an empty vector that breaks downstream encryption logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Function: correlated_randomness()] [num_chunks=1] If num_chunks is 1, the loop doesn't execute and r_0 equals F::zero() - can this degenerate case break encryption security? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Lines: 246-248] [Zero ell] What happens if ell is 0? Can this cause division by zero or return an incorrect number of chunks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Function: num_chunks_per_scalar()] [ell validation] The ell parameter must be 8, 16, 32, or 64 bits (as per chunks.rs) but is not validated here - can invalid ell values cause incorrect chunk counts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/chunked_elgamal.rs] [Lines: 247] [Type casting] The cast `ell as u32` could overflow if ell is very large - can this produce wrong chunk counts? (Low)
